pullRequest.body:
We prove several results involving partial sums of coefficients (or norm of coefficients) of  L-series. 

The two main results of this PR are:

- `LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO`: for `f : ℕ → ℂ`, if the partial sums `∑ k ∈ Icc 1 n, ‖f k‖` are `O(n ^ r)` for some real `0 ≤ r`, then the L-series `Lseries f` converges at `s : ℂ` for all `s` such that `r < s.re`.

- `LSeries_eq_mul_integral` : for `f : ℕ → ℂ`, if the partial sums `∑ k ∈ Icc 1 n, f k` are `O(n ^ r)` for some real `0 ≤ r` and the L-series `LSeries f` converges at `s : ℂ` with `r < s.re`, then `LSeries f s = s * ∫ t in Set.Ioi 1, (∑ k ∈ Icc 1 ⌊t⌋₊, f k) * t ^ (- (s + 1))`.

More results will be proved in #20660 

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [a49515e3d9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20661/commits/a49515e3d98b80b7bf015e5f786748040e650ea7)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.SpecificAsymptotics | 1358 | 1380 | +22 (+1.62%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Polynomial.Basic`|19|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.SpecificAsymptotics`|22|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.SumCoeff` (new file)|2148|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Asymptotics.isEquivalent_nat_ceil`
`+ Asymptotics.isEquivalent_nat_floor`
`+ IsBigO.mul_atTop_rpow_natCast_of_isBigO_rpow`
`+ IsBigO.mul_atTop_rpow_of_isBigO_rpow`
`+ LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO`
`+ LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO_and_nonneg`
`+ LSeries_eq_mul_integral`
`+ LSeries_eq_mul_integral'`
`+ LSeries_eq_mul_integral_of_nonneg`
`+ _root_.integrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`
`+ cpow_ne_zero_iff`
`+ cpow_ne_zero_iff_of_exponent_ne_zero`
`+ deriv_norm_ofReal_cpow`
`+ integrableAtFilter_rpow_atTop_iff`
`+ integrableOn_Ioi_deriv_norm_ofReal_cpow`
`+ integrableOn_Ioi_deriv_ofReal_cpow`
`+ locallyIntegrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`
`+ ne_zero_of_re_pos`
`+ norm_ofReal_cpow_eventually_eq_atTop`
`+ range_succ_eq_Icc_zero`
`+ re_neg_ne_zero_of_re_pos`
`+ term_def₀`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19944~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> I am not sure it is a good idea to have so many `private` declarations. When I first started contributing to mathlib, I was told that `private` was banned entirely; the rules have been relaxed somewhat, but I think indiscriminate use of `private` is still discouraged.
> 
> Many of these lemmas (not all, I admit) could potentially be useful elsewhere. Maybe they're not terribly interesting, but mathlib is full of dull-but-useful lemmas. Others have one-line proofs and are only used once in the file; so they can just be in-lined where used.

Yes, I know there are a lot of `private` results. I tried to keep the proof short (well, not too long) and thus added a lot of partial results (and it's even worse in the second PR). I'll try to clean it up a bit as you suggested by making some of them public and incorporating others in the proof.

@loefflerd, I got rid of almost all the private results. The easy ones are now proved where they are needed and I generalized (or tried to) the other ones and move them where they belong. It is possible that the PR is now more difficult to review. I can split it into several smaller PR if needed, just let me know.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
Thanks a lot for the reviews!

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: xroblot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+
Here's some feedback on all the files except the new one (will look at the new one later). All looks very good so far!

I am not sure it is a good idea to have so many `private` declarations. When I first started contributing to mathlib, I was told that `private` was banned entirely; the rules have been relaxed somewhat, but I think indiscriminate use of `private` is still discouraged.

Many of these lemmas (not all, I admit) could potentially be useful elsewhere. Maybe they're not terribly interesting, but mathlib is full of dull-but-useful lemmas. Others have one-line proofs and are only used once in the file; so they can just be in-lined where used.

Thanks for all the work you've put into this! I've suggested a bunch of changes, but almost all of them are entirely cosmetic – the only ones with any content are occasionally replacing explicit rewrites with automatic tactics (linarith, ring etc) for maintainability.

maintainer delegate

It's a pity that these theorems won't cover the case of `NNReal`, but I couldn't find a combination of typeclasses in mathlib that would apply in that case (we have "seminormed rings", but not "normed semirings"!) At some point we will probably want the version for the Int-valued floor function too, but that can come in another PR.

The converse of this is true as well, and might be useful. Can you add it? Here is a proof (might be golfable further)
```lean
theorem integrableAtFilter_rpow_atTop_iff {r : ℝ} :
    IntegrableAtFilter (fun x : ℝ ↦ x ^ r) atTop ↔ r < -1 := by
  refine ⟨fun h ↦ ?_, 
    fun hr ↦ ⟨Set.Ioi 1, Ioi_mem_atTop 1, (integrableOn_Ioi_rpow_iff zero_lt_one).mpr hr⟩⟩
  obtain ⟨s, hs, hr⟩ := h
  obtain ⟨t, ht⟩ := mem_atTop_sets.mp hs
  rw [← integrableOn_Ioi_rpow_iff (t := max t 1)]
  · exact hr.mono_set <| fun x hx ↦ ht _ <| (le_max_left t 1).trans hx.le
  · exact zero_lt_one.trans_le (le_max_right _ _)
```

Do you think something like the following should be added to Mathlib (with the suitable hypothesis): 
```
theorem integrableAtFilter_atTop_iff {α E : Type*} (f : α → E) (μ : Measure α := by volume_tac) :
    IntegrableAtFilter f atTop μ ↔ ∃ a, IntegrableOn f (Ioi a) μ := by
```
or maybe
```
theorem integrableAtFilter_atTop_iff {α E : Type*} (f : α → E) (μ : Measure α := by volume_tac) :
    IntegrableAtFilter f atTop μ ↔ ∀ᶠ a in atTop, IntegrableOn f (Ioi a) μ
```
I don't think that would make the proof of the `iff` statement shorter though.
Yes, I think we should definitely add one or the other; and I think the former is probably easier to apply in practice.

#21016.  

Still, I don't think that would be useful here. So I kept your proof since I couldn't do better :) Thanks!

There's a new policy that terminal simps shouldn't be squeezed, so `simp [hy]`. I also wonder whether it is maybe better for `cpow_ne_zero_iff` to be precisely the opposite of `cpow_eq_zero_iff`, i.e. `x ^ y ≠ 0 ↔ x ≠ 0 ∨ y = 0`; if you really want this exact statement, it could be called `cpow_ne_zero_iff_of_exponent_ne_zero` (very wordy, I know).
I implemented your suggestion
Without squeezing the terminal simp :)

If the theorem is to be "de-privatized", then probably it should get a slightly more specific name (`integrableOn_mul_sum_Icc_floor` perhaps?) so people don't find it by accident when searching for general analysis lemmas about integrals and sums.
I went with the slightly shorter `integrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`. I hope that's fine.
(same remark here)
Same as above, I changed the name to `locallyIntegrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`
This whole docstring is indented, please unindent

```suggestion
  `∑ k ∈ Icc 1 n, ‖f k‖` are `O(n ^ r)` for some real `0 ≤ r`, then the L-series `LSeries f`
```

```suggestion
  rw [LSeries.term]
  split_ifs with h <;> simp [h, hf, cpow_neg, div_eq_inv_mul]
```

`change` is generally best avoided:
```suggestion
  simp_rw [LSeriesSummable, funext (LSeries.term_def₀ hf s), mul_comm (f _)]
```

To save a line you can intro your variables in the `have`:
```suggestion
  have h₃ (t : ℝ) (ht : t ∈ Set.Ici 1) : DifferentiableAt ℝ (fun x : ℝ ↦ ‖(x : ℂ) ^ (-s)‖) t :=
    have ht' : t ≠ 0 := (zero_lt_one.trans_le ht).ne'
    (differentiableAt_id.ofReal_cpow_const ht' h₁).norm ℝ <|
      (cpow_ne_zero_iff_of_exponent_ne_zero h₁).mpr <| ofReal_ne_zero.mpr ht'
```

no space after unary `-` (here & one or two other places):
```suggestion
  have h₄ : (deriv fun t : ℝ ↦ ‖(t : ℂ) ^ (-s)‖) =ᶠ[atTop] fun t ↦ -s.re * t ^ (-(s.re +1)) := by
```

tiny golf:
```suggestion
  · refine (IsBigO.mul_atTop_rpow_natCast_of_isBigO_rpow _ _ _ ?_ hO h₂).congr_right (by simp)
```

dot-notation is your friend here:
```suggestion
  · refine h₄.isBigO.of_const_mul_right.mul_atTop_rpow_of_isBigO_rpow _ r _ ?_ le_rfl
    exact (hO.comp_tendsto tendsto_nat_floor_atTop).trans <|
      isEquivalent_nat_floor.isBigO.rpow hr (eventually_ge_atTop 0)
```

```suggestion
  · rwa [integrableAtFilter_rpow_atTop_iff, neg_add_lt_iff_lt_add, add_neg_cancel_right]
```

```suggestion
  have h₁ : (fun n ↦ if n = 0 then 0 else f n) =ᶠ[atTop] f := by
    filter_upwards [eventually_ne_atTop 0] with n hn using if_neg hn
  refine (LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO_aux (if_pos rfl) ?_ hr hs).congr' _ h₁
  refine hO.congr' (.of_forall fun _ ↦ Finset.sum_congr rfl fun _ h ↦ ?_) .rfl
  rw [if_neg (zero_lt_one.trans_le (mem_Icc.mp h).1).ne']
```

```suggestion
    LSeriesSummable (fun n ↦ f n) s := 
  LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO (by simpa [_root_.abs_of_nonneg (hf _)]) hr hs
```
(`Complex.abs_of_nonneg` should probably be `protected` to avoid this horrible `_root_` workaround, but that's a matter for another PR)
see above

```suggestion
    simpa using hr.trans_lt hs
```
(shorter and more robust)

golfs to
```suggestion
    refine (IsBigO.mul_atTop_rpow_natCast_of_isBigO_rpow (-s.re) _ _ ?_ hO ?_).trans_tendsto hlim
```

```suggestion
    · linarith
```

```suggestion
  · refine .mul_atTop_rpow_of_isBigO_rpow (-(s + 1).re) r _ ?_ ?_ (by rw [← neg_re, neg_add'])
    · simpa only [add_re, one_re, neg_add'] using isBigO_deriv_ofReal_cpow_const_atTop _
```

```suggestion
  rw [← LSeriesSummable_congr' s (f := fun n ↦ if n = 0 then 0 else f n)
    (by filter_upwards [eventually_ne_atTop 0] with n h using if_neg h)] at hS
  have (n) : ∑ k ∈ Icc 1 n, (if k = 0 then 0 else f k) = ∑ k ∈ Icc 1 n, f k :=
    Finset.sum_congr rfl fun k hk ↦ by rw [if_neg (zero_lt_one.trans_le (mem_Icc.mp hk).1).ne']
  rw [← LSeries_congr _ (fun _ ↦ if_neg _), LSeries_eq_mul_integral_aux (if_pos rfl) hr hs hS] <;>
  simp_all
```

```suggestion
    LSeries f s = s * ∫ t in Set.Ioi (1 : ℝ), (∑ k ∈ Icc 1 ⌊t⌋₊, f k) * t ^ (- (s + 1)) :=
  LSeries_eq_mul_integral _ hr hs (LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO hO hr hs)
    <| (isBigO_of_le _ fun _ ↦ (norm_sum_le _ _).trans <| Real.le_norm_self _).trans hO
```

```suggestion
  LSeries_eq_mul_integral' _ hr hs <| hO.congr_left fun _ ↦ by simp [_root_.abs_of_nonneg (hf _)]
```

```suggestion
    LSeriesSummable f s := by
```

```suggestion
  `r < s.re`, then `LSeries f s = s * ∫ t in Set.Ioi 1, (∑ k ∈ Icc 1 ⌊t⌋₊, f k) * t ^ (-(s + 1))`.
```

`simpa [-neg_add_rev, neg_add'] using isBigO_deriv_ofReal_cpow_const_atTop _` also works here, cf. [Zulip discussion on (not) squeezing terminal simps](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/request.3A.20discourage.20squeezing.20terminal.20simps.3F)
I tried to "unsqueeze" this `simp` but it didn't work, I see that the trick was to remove `neg_add_rev`. Thanks!

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): results involving partial sums of coefficients (part 1)

source.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): results involving partial sums of coefficients (part 2)
